column4: so, following the steps in the SetupNdiswrapperHowto, I was able to successfully compile and load the ndiswrapper module (kernel release 2.6.10-5-386) ... but the wlan0 interface still doesn't show up with "iwconfig" ... (card is broadcom BCM4306 chipset -- ndiswrapper -m shows the driver/hardware present).  Any suggestions?
did you modprobe ndiswrapper?
of course.  loaded successfully according to both lsmod, /var/log/messages
what does ifconfig say?
ifconfig lists eth0 and lo as interfaces.  iwconfig lists lo, eth0, sit0 with no wireless extensions
see what sudo iwlist scan will produce for you just curious if it detects anythign is all
lists those three interfaces, lo, eth0, sit0, with a note by each saying "interface doesn't support scanning"
ok
open up sudo nano /etc/network/interfaces
do you have a listing in there for wlan0?
no
add it
apend to the bottom of hte list
iface wlan0 inet dhcp ?
yep
then auto wlan0
ifup wlan0 reports SIOCSIFADDR: No such device
hmm i wonder
cause i seen this before
on my dell there is a function f2 key to turn on the radio transmitter
not sure abut your laptop or whatever but look and see if the physical switch is on for the wireless
there's no function of that sort on this particular laptop.
